3801.pronunciation: ho own kahee ho ane kahee ho er-khom'-en-os
3801.unicode: ὁ ὢν καί ὁ ἦν καί ὁ ἐρχόμενος
3801.translit: ho ṑn kaí ho ēn kaí ho erchómenos
3801.definition: [ὁ ὢν καί ὁ ἦν καί ὁ ἐρχόμενος] a phrase combining {{G3588}} with the present participle and imperfect of {{G1510}} and the present participle of {{G2064}} by means of {{G2532}}; the one being and the one that was and the one coming, i.e. the Eternal, as a divine epithet of Christ

3803.definition: [παγίς] from {{G4078}}; a trap (as fastened by a noose or notch); figuratively, a trick or statagem (temptation)

3804.definition: [πάθημα] from a presumed derivative of {{G3806}}; something undergone, i.e. hardship or pain; subjectively, an emotion or influence

3805.definition: [παθητός] from the same as {{G3804}}; liable (i.e. doomed) to experience pain

3806.definition: [πάθος] from the alternate of {{G3958}}; properly, suffering ("pathos"), i.e. (subjectively) a passion (especially concupiscence)

3807.definition: [παιδαγωγός] from {{G3816}} and a reduplicated form of {{G71}}; a boy-leader, i.e. a servant whose office it was to take the children to school; (by implication, (figuratively) a tutor ("pædagogue"))

3808.definition: [παιδάριον] neuter of a presumed derivative of {{G3816}}; a little boy

3809.definition: [παιδεία] from {{G3811}}; tutorage, i.e. education or training; by implication, disciplinary correction

3810.definition: [παιδευτής] from {{G3811}}; a trainer, i.e. teacher or (by implication) discipliner

3811.definition: [παιδεύω] from {{G3816}}; to train up a child, i.e. educate, or (by implication), discipline (by punishment)

3813.definition: [παιδίον] neuter diminutive of {{G3816}}; a childling (of either sex), i.e. (properly), an infant, or (by extension) a half-grown boy or girl; figuratively, an immature Christian

3814.definition: [παιδίσκη] feminine diminutive of {{G3816}}; a girl, i.e. (specially), a female slave or servant

3816.definition: [παῖς] perhaps from {{G3817}}; a boy (as often beaten with impunity), or (by analogy), a girl, and (genitive case) a child; specially, a slave or servant (especially a minister to a king; and by eminence to God)

3817.definition: [παίω] a primary verb; to hit (as if by a single blow and less violently than {{G5180}}); specially, to sting (as a scorpion)

3818.definition: [Πακατιανή] feminine of an adjective of uncertain derivation; Pacatianian, a section of Phrygia

3819.definition: [πάλαι] probably another form for {{G3825}} (through the idea of retrocession); (adverbially) formerly, or (by relatively) sometime since; (elliptically as adjective) ancient

3820.definition: [παλαιός] from {{G3819}}; antique, i.e. not recent, worn out

3822.definition: [παλαιόω] from {{G3820}}; to make (passively, become) worn out, or declare obsolete

3823.definition: [πάλη] from πάλλω (to vibrate; another form for {{G906}}); wrestling

3824.definition: [παλιγγενεσία] from {{G3825}} and {{G1078}}; (spiritual) rebirth (the state or the act), i.e. (figuratively) spiritual renovation; specially, Messianic restoration

3825.definition: [πάλιν] probably from the same as {{G3823}} (through the idea of oscillatory repetition); (adverbially) anew, i.e. (of place) back, (of time) once more, or (conjunctionally) furthermore or on the other hand

3826.definition: [παμπληθεί] dative case (adverb) of a compound of {{G3956}} and {{G4128}}; in full multitude, i.e. concertedly or simultaneously

3827.definition: [πάμπολυς] from {{G3956}} and {{G4183}}; full many, i.e. immense

3828.definition: [Παμφυλία] from a compound of {{G3956}} and {{G4443}}; every-tribal, i.e. heterogeneous ({{G5561}} being implied); Pamphylia, a region of Asia Minor

3829.definition: [πανδοχεῖον] neuter of a presumed compound of {{G3956}} and a derivative of {{G1209}}; all-receptive, i.e. a public lodging-place (caravanserai or khan)

3830.definition: [πανδοχεύς] from the same as {{G3829}}; an innkeeper (warden of a caravanserai)

3831.definition: [πανήγυρις] from {{G3956}} and a derivative of {{G58}}; a mass-meeting, i.e. (figuratively) universal companionship

3832.definition: [πανοικί] adverb from {{G3956}} and {{G3624}}; with the whole family

3833.definition: [πανοπλία] from a compound of {{G3956}} and {{G3696}}; full armor ("panoply")

3834.definition: [πανουργία] from {{G3835}}; adroitness, i.e. (in a bad sense) trickery or sophistry

3836.definition: [πανταχόθεν] adverb (of source) from {{G3837}}; from all directions

3837.definition: [πανταχοῦ] genitive case (as adverb of place) of a presumed derivative of {{G3956}}; universally

3838.definition: [παντελής] from {{G3956}} and {{G5056}}; full-ended, i.e. entire (neuter as noun, completion)

3840.definition: [πάντοθεν] adverb (of source) from {{G3956}}; from (i.e. on) all sides

3841.definition: [παντοκράτωρ] from {{G3956}} and {{G2904}}; the all-ruling, i.e. God (as absolute and universal sovereign)

3842.definition: [πάντοτε] from {{G3956}} and {{G3753}}; every when, i.e. at all times

3843.definition: [πάντως] adverb from {{G3956}}; entirely; specially, at all events, (with negative, following) in no event

3844.definition: [παρά] a primary preposition; properly, near; i.e. (with genitive case) from beside (literally or figuratively), (with dative case) at (or in) the vicinity of (objectively or subjectively), (with accusative case) to the proximity with (local (especially beyond or opposed to) or causal (on account of) In compounds it retains the same variety of application.

3845.definition: [παραβαίνω] from {{G3844}} and the base of {{G939}}; to go contrary to, i.e. violate a command

3846.definition: [παραβάλλω] from {{G3844}} and {{G906}}; to throw alongside, i.e. (reflexively) to reach a place, or (figuratively) to liken

3849.definition: [παραβιάζομαι] from {{G3844}} and the middle voice of {{G971}}; to force contrary to (nature), i.e. compel (by entreaty)

3850.definition: [παραβολή] from {{G3846}}; a similitude ("parable"), i.e. (symbolic) fictitious narrative (of common life conveying a moral), apothegm or adage

3851.definition: [παραβουλεύομαι] from {{G3844}} and the middle voice of {{G1011}}; to misconsult, i.e. disregard

3853.definition: [παραγγέλλω] from {{G3844}} and the base of {{G32}}; to transmit a message, i.e. (by implication) to enjoin

3854.definition: [παραγίνομαι] from {{G3844}} and {{G1096}}; to become near, i.e. approach (have arrived); by implication, to appear publicly

3855.definition: [παράγω] from {{G3844}} and {{G71}}; to lead near, i.e. (reflexively or intransitively) to go along or away

3856.definition: [παραδειγματίζω] from {{G3844}} and {{G1165}}; to show alongside (the public), i.e. expose to infamy

3857.definition: [παράδεισος] of Oriental origin (compare {{H6508}}); a park, i.e. (specially), an Eden (place of future happiness, "paradise")

3858.definition: [παραδέχομαι] from {{G3844}} and {{G1209}}; to accept near, i.e. admit or (by implication) delight in

3859.definition: [παραδιατριβή] from a compound of {{G3844}} and {{G1304}}; misemployment, i.e. meddlesomeness

3860.definition: [παραδίδωμι] from {{G3844}} and {{G1325}}; to surrender, i.e yield up, intrust, transmit

3861.definition: [παράδοξος] from {{G3844}} and {{G1391}} (in the sense of seeming); contrary to expectation, i.e. extraordinary ("paradox")

3862.definition: [παράδοσις] from {{G3860}}; transmission, i.e. (concretely) a precept; specially, the Jewish traditionary law

3863.definition: [παραζηλόω] from {{G3844}} and {{G2206}}; to stimulate alongside, i.e. excite to rivalry

3864.definition: [παραθαλάσσιος] from {{G3844}} and {{G2281}}; along the sea, i.e. maritime (lacustrine)

3865.definition: [παραθεωρέω] from {{G3844}} and {{G2334}}; to overlook or disregard

3867.definition: [παραινέω] from {{G3844}} and {{G134}}; to mispraise, i.e. recommend or advise (a different course)

3868.definition: [παραιτέομαι] from {{G3844}} and the middle voice of {{G154}}; to beg off, i.e. deprecate, decline, shun

3869.definition: [παρακαθίζω] from {{G3844}} and {{G2523}}; to sit down near

3870.definition: [παρακαλέω] from {{G3844}} and {{G2564}}; to call near, i.e. invite, invoke (by imploration, hortation or consolation)

3871.definition: [παρακαλύπτω] from {{G3844}} and {{G2572}}; to cover alongside, i.e. veil (figuratively)

3872.definition: [παρακαταθήκη] from a compound of {{G3844}} and {{G2698}}; something put down alongside, i.e. a deposit (sacred trust)

3873.definition: [παράκειμαι] from {{G3844}} and {{G2749}}; to lie near, i.e. be at hand (figuratively, be prompt or easy)

3877.definition: [παρακολουθέω] from {{G3844}} and {{G190}}; to follow near, i.e. (figuratively) attend (as a result), trace out, conform to

3878.definition: [παρακούω] from {{G3844}} and {{G191}}; to mishear, i.e. (by implication) to disobey

3879.definition: [παρακύπτω] from {{G3844}} and {{G2955}}; to bend beside, i.e. lean over (so as to peer within)

3880.definition: [παραλαμβάνω] from {{G3844}} and {{G2983}}; to receive near, i.e. associate with oneself (in any familiar or intimate act or relation); by analogy, to assume an office; figuratively, to learn

3881.definition: [παραλέγομαι] from {{G3844}} and the middle voice of {{G3004}} (in its original sense); (specially), to lay one's course near, i.e. sail past

3882.definition: [παράλιος] from {{G3844}} and {{G251}}; beside the salt (sea), i.e. maritime

3883.definition: [παραλλαγή] from a compound of {{G3844}} and {{G236}}; transmutation (of phase or orbit), i.e. (figuratively) fickleness

3884.definition: [παραλογίζομαι] from {{G3844}} and {{G3049}}; to misreckon, i.e. delude

3885.definition: [παραλυτικός] from a derivative of {{G3886}}; as if dissolved, i.e. "paralytic"

3886.definition: [παραλύω] from {{G3844}} and {{G3089}}; to loosen beside, i.e. relax (perfect passive participle, paralyzed or enfeebled)

3887.definition: [παραμένω] from {{G3844}} and {{G3306}}; to stay near, i.e. remain (literally, tarry; or figuratively, be permanent, persevere)

3888.definition: [παραμυθέομαι] from {{G3844}} and the middle voice of a derivative of {{G3454}}; to relate near, i.e. (by implication) encourage, console

3891.definition: [παρανομέω] from a compound of {{G3844}} and {{G3551}}; to be opposed to law, i.e. to transgress

3893.definition: [παραπικραίνω] from {{G3844}} and {{G4087}}; to embitter alongside, i.e. (figuratively) to exasperate

3895.definition: [παραπίπτω] from {{G3844}} and {{G4098}}; to fall aside, i.e. (figuratively) to apostatize

3897.definition: [παραπλήσιον] neuter of a compound of {{G3844}} and the base of {{G4139}} (as adverb); close by, i.e. (figuratively) almost

3898.definition: [παραπλησίως] adverb from the same as {{G3897}}; in a manner near by, i.e. (figuratively) similarly

3900.definition: [παράπτωμα] from {{G3895}}; a side-slip (lapse or deviation), i.e. (unintentional) error or (wilful) transgression
